title: Johnny Isakson, Former Georgia Republican U.S. Senator, Dies at 76
sub_head: Legislator was known as effective, behind-the-scenes consensus builder
body:
ATLANTA—Johnny Isakson, an affable Georgia Republican politician who rose from the ranks of the state Legislature to become a U.S. senator known as an effective, behind-the-scenes consensus builder, died Sunday. He was 76 years old.
His son John Isakson told the Associated Press that his father died in his sleep before dawn Sunday at his home in Atlanta. John Isakson said that although his father had Parkinson’s disease, the cause of death wasn’t immediately apparent.
